    • Method Detail

      • sendWOL

        public void sendWOL(java.lang.String macSpec,
                    java.lang.String interfacename)
        Send a Wake On Lan "Magic Packet"
        Parameters:
        macSpec - The MAC address to wake, in the form aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff or aa-bb-cc-dd-ee-ff
        interfacename - optional name of the network interface to send the packet with. If null, will send to all interfaces which have broadcast addresses

      • sendWOL

        public void sendWOL(java.lang.String macSpec)
        Send a Wake On Lan "Magic Packet"
        Parameters:
        macSpec - The MAC address to wake, in the form aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff or aa-bb-cc-dd-ee-ff

      • sendNetMessage

        public java.lang.String sendNetMessage(java.lang.String host,
                                       int port,
                                       java.lang.String message,
                                       boolean udp,
                                       int timeoutMillis)
        Send a simple, raw network message via TCP or UDP to a given host and port, and optionally read a single-line response. This is intended for simple automation protocols. If you need more flexibility, look into the libraries of your scripting language. Note: The complete script engine will block while waiting timeoutMillis. It is recommended to keep the value as low as possible. Do not set it to a value higher than zero unless you really need the response.
        Parameters:
        host - the host to send the message to. Either an IP address or a hostname.
        port - the port number (1-65535)
        message - the payload of the message
        udp - if true, UDP will be used, TCP otherwise
        timeoutMillis - amount of time to wait for a response. If 0, we don't wait
        Returns:
        the received response, or null if anything went wrong or a timeout occured

      • sendNetMessage

        public void sendNetMessage(java.lang.String host,
                           int port,
                           java.lang.String message,
                           boolean udp)
        Send a simple, raw network message via TCP or UDP to a given host and port. This is intended for simple automation protocols. If you need more flexibility, look into the libraries of your scripting language.
        Parameters:
        host - the host to send the message to. Either an IP address or a hostname.
        port - the port number (1-65535)
        message - the payload of the message
        udp - if true, UDP will be used, TCP otherwise

      • executeCommand

        public java.lang.String executeCommand(java.lang.String cmd)
        Execute a command with the system's command interpreter. Returns the command's output, or null in case execution failed. If the output contains multiple lines, they are seperated by newlines. The last (or only) line will not have a newline appended.
        Parameters:
        cmd - The command to execute @see Process.exec
        Returns:
        the output of the command as a string, or null.
